intro: Kielmeyera speciosa var. minor, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and attractive, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 15 meters tall. Due to its ornamental value and the high demand for its timber, it is considered a threatened species in its natural habitat.
